alert.note: Alert for St. Tammany (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 06 at 10:22AM CST until January 07 at 10:00AM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Louisiana... Tchefuncte River Above U.S. Highway 190 Near Covington affecting St. Tammany Parish. For the Tchefuncte River...including Folsom, U.S. Highway 190 Near Covington...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tchefuncte River Above U.S. Highway 190 Near Covington. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...Above 20.0 feet, Water will be in Camp Tchefuncte`s parking lot. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 AM CST Friday the stage was 22.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:30 AM CST Friday was 22.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late tonight and continue falling to 14.0 feet Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 22.1 feet on 01/02/2007. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lix. Click on the Rivers and Lakes menu for forecasts and observations. The next statement will be issued when updates are needed.
